name: Creamed Pearled Onions
description: Rich creamed onions with Gruyère, best made a day ahead.
ingredients: ¼ cup white wine or dry vermouth
¼ cup grated Gruyère or Parmesan
Optional: crispy pancetta, fresh thyme leaves, butter
instructions: DAY BEFORE (Make Ahead): Glaze the Onions. Heat butter + olive oil in a skillet. Add onions + sugar and sauté 5–7 minutes. Add white wine, reduce. Add stock + thyme, simmer until glazed. Cool and refrigerate.
Prepare the Cream Base: Add cream, salt, pepper, and optional sherry to a saucepan. Simmer 5-7 mins. Cool and refrigerate.
THANKSGIVING DAY: Combine glazed onions and cream base in a skillet. Heat until simmering.
Stir in cheese (Gruyère or Parmesan). Simmer 1 minute until melted.
Serve immediately, or bake as a casserole at 350°F for 15 minutes.
